REC and PFC shares may rise up to 31% from current levels, Emkay says - CNBCTV18
summary:
REC and PFC Shares Expected to Rise by Up to 31%, Says Emkay

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Brokerage firm Emkay Global has initiated coverage on shares of state-run power financing companies REC Ltd. and Power Finance Corporation (PFC), assigning both a 'Buy' rating.

Emkay has set a price target of ₹650 for REC and ₹600 for PFC, implying a potential upside of 25% and 31%, respectively, from Thursday's closing levels.

  • REC and PFC are down over 20% from their record highs.
  • Emkay's optimistic outlook is based on long-term capital expenditure plans in the sector.
  • Valuations remain reasonable despite higher estimates when considering growth potential.
“Sustained double-digit loan growth and improving asset quality support robust earnings visibility for companies in the sector.”

The brokerage anticipates strong credit demand and robust earnings, despite players trading at a discount to their book values.

title: Blinkit launches 10-minute ambulance service in Gurgaon - The Times of India
summary:
Blinkit Launches 10-Minute Ambulance Service in Gurgaon

Publication Date: October 23, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Blinkit has introduced a new 10-minute ambulance service in Gurgaon, aimed at providing rapid medical assistance to patients in emergencies.

  • The service is designed to address the critical need for timely medical intervention.
  • Blinkit aims to leverage its existing logistics network to facilitate quick access to ambulances.
  • This initiative could significantly reduce emergency response times and potentially save lives.
  • The service is available via the Blinkit app for quick booking.

The introduction of this service marks an important step towards ensuring better healthcare access in urban areas.

title: ITC demerger record date: Last date to BUY to get ITC Hotels shares - ET Now
summary:
ITC Demerger Record Date: Last Chance to Buy Shares for Free ITC Hotels Shares

Updated: January 3, 2025, Source: ET NOW News

January 3 is the last date to buy ITC shares to qualify for ITC Hotels shares. With the ex-date falling on January 6, investors must act before January 4-5, when markets will be closed.

  • ITC shares must be bought by January 3 to qualify for ITC Hotels shares.
  • Pre-open session for price discovery on January 6, 2025, at 9:00 AM.
  • ITC Hotels will continue within indices for three trading days post-demerger.
  • Shareholders will receive one share of ITC Hotels for every 10 shares of ITC held.
  • Market experts predict varying target prices for ITC shares, with some reaching upwards of Rs 575.
“ITC will continue to hold 40% stake in ITC Hotels which should be seen as a positive for shareholders.” - Amnish Aggarwal, Head - Research, Prabhudas Lilladher

The impending ITC Hotels demerger is poised to benefit both sectors and shareholders, showcasing strategic value creation within ITC Ltd.
newTitle: ITC Demerger Record Date: Last Chance to Buy Shares for Free ITC Hotels Shares

Kia Syros Bookings Open, Launch On February 1, 2025 - CarDekho
summary:
Kia Syros Bookings Open, Launch On February 1, 2025

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: CarDekho.com

Kia has opened bookings for the new Syros SUV with a token amount of Rs 25,000 ahead of its launch on February 1, 2025.

  • Bookings for the Kia Syros are open.
  • It slots between the Sonet and Seltos in Kia's line-up.
  • Available in six variants: HTK, HTK (O), HTK Plus, HTX, HTX Plus, HTX Plus (O).
  • Engine options include a 1L turbo petrol and a 1.5L diesel.
  • Features include ventilated seats, dual 12.3-inch screens, and ADAS.
  • Expected pricing starts at Rs 9.7 lakhs (ex-showroom).

The Kia Syros will be showcased at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025, with deliveries expected soon after the launch.

“Kia is offering the Syros with various segment-first features, ensuring a competitive edge in the market.”

Overall, the Kia Syros is positioned as an exciting new entry in the SUV segment, blending modern features with competitive pricing.
newTitle: Kia Syros Bookings Open, Launch On February 1, 2025

title: Tata Motors, three other shares get added to CLSA India model portfolio; HDFC Bank out - CNBCTV18
summary:
Tata Motors, three other shares get added to CLSA India model portfolio; HDFC Bank out

Publication Date: Not available Source: CNBC TV18

CLSA has made adjustments to its India focus portfolio by adding Tata Motors and three other companies while removing HDFC Bank due to recent market performance and economic predictions.

  • Tata Motors, NTPC, Nestle India, and Britannia have been added to the model portfolio.
  • HDFC Bank has been removed following a downgrade of the bank sector's outlook.
  • CLSA noted that Tata Motors has shown a 35% decline in its share price from its peak, factoring in potential risks.
  • The additions occurred due to corrections in stock prices, presenting a buying opportunity according to CLSA.
“Less severe trade restrictions may attract inflows into EMs like China, which could make India underperform in a broader EM rally led by laggards.”

In conclusion, CLSA's revised focus on stocks reflects an adaptation to current economic conditions and anticipated market movements for 2025.
newTitle: Tata Motors and Other Stocks Added to CLSA India Model Portfolio, HDFC Bank Removed

title: Jeff Bezos' $500M Yacht hit with surprise raid as Lauren Sánchez's sunbathing gets interrupted by customs officers - Hindustan Times
summary:
Surprise Customs Check Interrupts Bezos' Yacht Day

Date: Jan 03, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

While Lauren Sánchez was sunbathing aboard Jeff Bezos' $500 million yacht, customs officers conducted a surprise inspection, causing a brief interruption on New Year's Eve.

  • Customs officials boarded the yacht for a routine inspection that lasted approximately three hours.
  • Lauren Sánchez appeared unbothered, engaging with friends during the check.
  • Jeff Bezos was not present during the customs inspection.
  • Speculation about a lavish New Year’s Eve wedding was denied by Bezos.
“This whole thing is completely false — none of this is happening,” Bezos stated regarding the wedding rumors.

The unexpected customs check added an unusual twist to what was planned as a luxurious day on the high seas.
newTitle: Surprise Customs Check Interrupts Bezos' Yacht Day

title: Scamster Ketan Parekh back in Sebi net, banned from market - The Times of India
summary:
Ketan Parekh Banned from Market by Sebi

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Ketan Parekh, a notorious figure in Indian stock market history, has found himself once again in the regulatory spotlight as he faces a ban from the market imposed by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi). This development highlights ongoing concerns about market manipulation and investor protection.

  • Parekh is a key figure in a major stock market scam that erupted in 2001.
  • The ban comes amidst efforts by Sebi to clean up the financial markets and safeguard investor interests.
  • Parekh is accused of stock price manipulation and fraudulent trading activities.
  • This renewed scrutiny raises questions about the integrity of the Indian financial system.
“We are committed to ensuring a fair and transparent trading environment in the stock market,” said a Sebi spokesperson.

This action against Parekh signals a stricter regulatory approach to market misconduct, aiming to enhance overall market integrity.
newTitle: Ketan Parekh Banned from Market by Sebi

Why the US dollar is so strong to start the year - ForexLive
summary:
Why the US dollar is so strong to start the year

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: Forexlive

The US dollar is the top performer as it surges at the start of 2025, outperforming major currencies like the euro and pound. This performance is driven by strong capital flows toward US assets, with US equity markets vastly outperforming others.

  • The US dollar is up more than 1% against the euro and pound.
  • The recent economic news included initial jobless claims and soft data on construction spending and manufacturing sentiment.
  • Capital flows are the main driver of the dollar's strength, with significant investment occurring in US markets.
  • There are risks such as tariffs and fiscal policies that could affect the markets.
  • Investors see a big opportunity when markets shift, similar to Argentina's market performance after political changes.
“The short answer is that right now the US and US companies are not just winning, but they're running up the score.”

The US dollar's strong performance is a result of sustained capital flows and market dynamics, with potential risks ahead that could impact the trend.
newTitle: Why the US dollar is so strong to start the year

title: Stocks to Watch on January 3: Varun Beverages, NHPC, Hindustan Zinc, Wockhardt and more - CNBCTV18
summary:
Stocks to Watch on January 3: Varun Beverages, NHPC, Hindustan Zinc, Wockhardt and More

Publication Date: January 3, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

This article discusses stocks to watch today, including Varun Beverages and NHPC, alongside their recent developments and financial performance.

  • Varun Beverages: Announced a ₹413 crore investment in South African subsidiary Bevco, acquiring an additional 2.42% shareholding.
  • NHPC: Received a ₹250 crore payment under its Mega Insurance Policy following business interruption losses due to a flash flood.
  • Hindustan Zinc: Reported a 2% decrease in mined metal production year-on-year but a 3% increase compared to the previous quarter.
  • Wockhardt: Received CDSCO approval for Miqnaf, a new treatment for Community-Acquired Bacterial Pneumonia.
  • Biocon: Secured approval from the NMPA in China for Tacrolimus capsules used in organ transplant patients.
  • Avenue Supermarts: Reported a 17.5% year-on-year increase in standalone revenue to ₹15,565.23 crore.
  • RITES: Awarded a ₹69.78 crore contract by SAIL for repairs of locomotives.
  • Bank of Maharashtra: Announced a 16.9% year-on-year increase in total business to ₹5.08 lakh crore.
  • Pricol: Approved divestment of its wiping business to Auto Ignition Ltd for ₹20 crore.
  • Honasa Consumer: Chief Business Officer Master Zairus resigned effective February 28, 2025.
  • Capital Small Finance Bank: Reported a 12% increase in total deposits to ₹8,384 crore.
“We aim to strengthen our balance sheet and support future growth,” said Varun Beverages regarding their recent investment.

This article highlights significant stock movements and news that investors should monitor for informed decision-making in the market.
newTitle: Stocks to Watch on January 3: Varun Beverages, NHPC, Hindustan Zinc, Wockhardt and More

title: Hindenburg Research claims used-car dealer Carvana's involvement in $800 million loan sales undisclosed transactions | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Hindenburg Research Accuses Carvana of $800 Million Loan Misconduct

Published on: January 2, 2024, Source: Live Mint

US-based short seller Hindenburg Research has alleged that Carvana Co., an online car dealer, engaged in $800 million of loan sales involving undisclosed related party transactions. Following the report's release, Carvana's stock dropped nearly 5%.

Key Points:

  • Hindenburg's report claims $800 million in undisclosed loan sales by Carvana.
  • The report suggests accounting manipulation and lax underwriting practices.
  • Despite bankruptcy risks in previous years, Carvana's stock surged 284% in 2024.
  • Used vehicle prices have dropped 20.3% over the past three years, creating significant headwinds for Carvana.
  • The company's solvency is questioned due to insider stock unloading.
“For every $1 in net income it reported, the company has added $139 in market cap – a $34 billion market cap increase,” Hindenburg alleged.

Hindenburg Research has established a short position in Carvana shares, projecting serious concerns regarding the company's financial practices and future viability.
newTitle: Hindenburg Research Accuses Carvana of $800 Million Loan Misconduct

title: Sebi bans Ketan Parekh, 2 others from markets in front-running scam, impounds Rs 65 crore - The Economic Times
summary:
Sebi Bans Ketan Parekh and Associates in Front-Running Scam, Seizes ₹65 Crore

Publication Date: Thursday | Source: The Economic Times

The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has barred Ketan Parekh and Rohit Salgaocar from the Indian capital markets due to their involvement in a front-running scam, resulting in the impounding of ₹65.77 crore.

  • Ketan Parekh, known for his role in the 2001 stock scam, faces renewed restrictions.
  • Sebi's investigation revealed unlawful gains earned through front-running activities.
  • The accused exploited non-public information related to a foreign portfolio investment.
"Noticees no. 1 and 2 i.e. Rohit Salgaocar and Ketan Parekh devised the entire scheme to unjustly enrich from the NPI pertaining to the Big Client by orchestrating front running activities." - Sebi's Order

The ruling emphasizes the importance of regulatory oversight in preventing similar fraudulent activities in the future.
newTitle: Sebi Bans Ketan Parekh and Associates in Front-Running Scam, Seizes ₹65 Crore

Major cryptocurrencies including Solana and XRP are experiencing significant gains as Bitcoin and Dogecoin reach weekly highs.

  • Solana (SOL) is up 10% to $209, marking its highest price since December 19.
  • XRP is up 11% to $2.41, touching a peak of $2.44 earlier.
  • Dogecoin rises to $0.34, up more than 7% on the day.
  • Bitcoin climbs above the $97,000 mark, up 3.5% in 24 hours.

“Many have liquidated both traditional and crypto assets to offset tax gains,” said Isaac Joshua, CEO of Gems.

The recent spikes in these cryptocurrencies reflect a positive momentum in the market, likely driven by Bitcoin's recovery.

Tesla deliveries miss expectations, stock drops - Investing.com
summary:
Tesla Stock Falls 7% Following Lower-Than-Expected Q4 Deliveries

Publication Date: January 5, 2024 Source: Investing.com

Tesla reported record vehicle deliveries but fell short of market expectations, leading to a significant drop in stock prices.

  • Tesla delivered 495,570 vehicles in Q4, below the expected 512,277.
  • Shares fell over 7% at market open after the announcement.
  • In 2023, Tesla delivered a total of 1.79 million vehicles, marking a decline in annual EV sales for the first time in over a decade.
  • Energy storage deployments reached a total of 31.4 GWh for the year.
  • Tesla plans to release its Q4 2024 financial results on January 29, 2025.
"Overall, we would characterize this is a respectable delivery number although the Street and bulls wanted to see a 500k+ number and the stock will be a bit weak on the knee-jerk reaction." - Wedbush

The report highlights challenges Tesla faces in meeting investor expectations despite strong overall performance and ambitious growth plans.
newTitle: Tesla Stock Falls 7% Following Lower-Than-Expected Q4 Deliveries

title: Sebi clubs fund diversion, disclosure violation probes against ZEE, Punit Goenka and Subhash Chandra | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Sebi Combines Probes Against ZEE, Punit Goenka, and Subhash Chandra

Publication Date: January 2, 2023

Source: Live Mint

The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has consolidated ongoing investigations into Zee Entertainment Enterprises Ltd (ZEEL) and its executives over allegations of fund diversion and disclosure violations.

  • Sebi has clubbed investigations against ZEEL, CEO Punit Goenka, and former chairman Subhash Chandra.
  • Allegations include failure to comply with listing regulations and corporate governance violations.
  • A show-cause notice was issued in July 2022, questioning the actions of the involved parties.
  • Settlement applications filed by Zee and Goenka were rejected in April 2023, leading to further investigations.
  • An interim order barred Chandra and Goenka from holding key positions in listed companies amid the allegations.
  • Sebi's investigations into LODR violations will now be included in the funds diversion probe.
  • The proceeding against the company and executives were dropped to avoid multiplicity of cases.
“The allegations in the show-cause notice of 6 July 2022 issued by the adjudicating officer are to be subsumed with the findings of the further investigation carried out by SEBI in the instant (funds diversion) matter.”

This development is significant as it centralizes the investigation process and streamlines legal proceedings within the corporate governance framework.
newTitle: Sebi Combines Probes Against ZEE, Punit Goenka, and Subhash Chandra

title: This Indian CEO Is The Highest-Paid Employee In The World; This Is His Salary... - News18
summary:
Jagdeep Singh: The Highest-Paid CEO in the World

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: News18

Jagdeep Singh holds the title for the highest annual salary in the world at Rs 17,500 crore, with earnings that reflect his significant impact on the evolving landscape of wealth and technology.

  • Singh earns an astonishing Rs 48 crore per day, surpassing the annual revenue of many corporations.
  • He is the founder of Quantumscape, a leader in electric car battery technology.
  • Singh's monthly income stands at Rs 1,459 crore, setting a new benchmark for salary globally.
  • His academic background includes a B.Tech from Stanford University and an MBA from the University of California.
  • Quantumscape is driving innovations in electric vehicle technology, contributing to sustainable transportation.
  • Singh's journey from an employee to a CEO exemplifies the potential of entrepreneurship and innovation.
“Singh is King,” reflecting the pride in his achievement as the highest-paid employee worldwide.

Jagdeep Singh’s story serves as an inspiration for aspiring entrepreneurs, highlighting the intersection of technology, opportunity, and financial success.
newTitle: Jagdeep Singh: The Highest-Paid CEO in the World
